Comments_List: With no previous experience in literary Japanese, I was able to develop a strong foundation of language skills over the semester, ultimately enabling me to grammatically parse and translate the opening section of a premodern text.

Professor Kamens wonderful course truly developed and improved his students grammatical and conceptual analyses of Medieval Japanese works, via his detailed and careful instruction of essential grammatical knowledge and literary contexts. For instance, Professor Kamens wondrously demonstrated to his students how one can utilize previously memorized grammatical logics in order to learn new grammatical forms, such as the application of the grammatical forms of the  forms that are very much similar to the  of the  and . Also, Professor Kamens kindly specifying many essential  limited to particular , during the students acquiring knowledge concerning them, deepened their comprehension of this grammatical factor. Professor Kamens enabled his students to comprehensively analyze the grammatical forms of a particular literary Japanese sentence, by means of ones starting its grammatical analysis from its last word. Furthermore, Professor Kamens insightful  interventions during class discussions, concerning the literary and historical contexts of the Japanese sentences, augmented and diversified students acquisition of literary Japanese grammar. Because of Professor Kamens combinatory teaching of literary Japanese grammar and Japanese literature, students were able to appreciate and marvel at how literary significance and nuances originate and found themselves upon minute grammatical details. All in all, Professor Kamens course consists of a comprehensive and profound introduction to the grammar and context of literary Japanese.

This is one of the most well-designed, intellectually gratifying courses I have taken at Yale. It is clearly the result of many years of thought and fine tuning, and provides students with an array of useful learning and reference tools to be used for years to come.

Professor Kamens course successfully and effectively instructed students about literary Japanese, in a multidimensional and diverse manner. For instance, the three parsing quizzes developed the students memorized grammatical skills and transformed them into a more coherent form, because of Professor Kamens encouraging students to cumulatively synthesize various grammatical knowledge within their analysis of a single sentence. Additionally, Professor Kamens wondrously incorporated literary aspects of the works within the students learning, via his profound and informative presentations of the works historical and literary contexts and his incorporation of electronic Learning Tools that presented some annotated versions of the sentences analyzed in class. For instance, Professor Kamens elaborate and detailed explanation of the verb  as a vocabulary signifying not only to look but also to enter in an intimate relationship truly deepened and diversified students interpretation of literary Japanese sentences that include this particular verb. Also, Professor Kamens assigning the final project of grammatical analyses and English translation of a specific part of a particular literary Japanese work, as chosen by the student, culminated students comprehension of literary Japanese, due to this projects obliging them to combine their knowledge of literary Japanese grammar with the historical and literary context of the work. In summary, Professor Kamens course demonstrates a wondrous and diverse introduction to literary Japanese.
I strongly recommend this course to any student with an interest in premodern literature, poetry, Japanese culture, or linguistics.

Yes, I would most definitely recommend this course to my colleagues who have yet to take it, because a diverse and multifaceted learning experience awaits them. Professor Kamens elaborate and comprehensive explanations of the basic fundamentals of literary Japanese grammar, such as the  forms and the many , clarify even the most challenging aspects of literary Japanese grammar. Furthermore, the cumulative grammar parsings, as Professor Kamens assigns in the weekly sentence analyses and the quizzes, strengthens students learning of literary Japanese grammar, because of their juxtaposition of many different grammatical forms. Also, Professor Kamens wonderful and diverse introduction to literary trends and historical contexts of the sentences, as demonstrated in his weekly interventions and his assignment of the final grammar parsing and English translation project, enables his students to combine their knowledge of literary Japanese grammar with literary analysis. All in all, Professor Kamens course certainly develops and improves all students grammatical and analytical skills concerning literary Japanese.
